_header: O hope indeed thou help me
Note: For another text see 3021; and cf. 2190.
Title(s): ‘O spes in morte me salua maria precor te’
Subjects: dialogues, death and man; Virgin Mary, as speaker in debate; translations; death; angels; Satan; illustrations, verses accompanying
_description: Dialogue between the soul of a dying person, Death, the Devil, an Angel, the Virgin Mary, Christ and God, a translation of ‘O spes in morte me salua maria precor te’, by ‘Wilfridus’

BLCottFausBVI.First Lines: O hope indede þu helpe megoddes moder I pray ye…
BLCottFausBVI.Last Lines: …Sone als þu biddes it sall bena thinge will I deny þe
BLCottFausBVI.Note: Written in speech banners from the mouths of illustrated figures; includes former DIMEV 5755 [NIMEV 3642.77].

         167 (1935): 20-35: 23.
